oai_dc:dc.dc:title: School children at C. T. Kirkpatrick Elementary School, Nashville, Tennessee, 1955 January
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: School children at the C. T. Kirkpatrick Elementary School, located at 1000 Sevier Street, Nashville, Tennessee, circa January 1955. Kirkpatrick Elementary School opened in December 1952, named for C. T. Kirkpatrick who graduated from Fogg High School and Vanderbilt University, taught Latin at Fogg High School, and served as principal of Hume-Fogg High School from 1914 until his retirement in 1940. Kirkpatrick School offered grades 1-6 until 1971. At that time the school was paired with Warner School. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: C. T. Kirkpatrick Elementary School (Nashville, Tenn.)
